context: The original model Famicom featured two game controllers, both of which were <a0_0><b5_0>hardwired<b5_0/><a0_0/> to the back of the console. The second controller lacked the START and <a1_0><b6_0>SELECT<b6_0/><a1_0/> buttons, but featured a small <a2_0><b7_0>microphone<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Relatively few games made use of this feature. The earliest produced Famicom units initially had <a3_0>square<a3_0/> A and B buttons. This was changed to the <a4_0><b9_0>circular<b9_0/><a4_0/> designs because of the <b8_0>square<b8_0/> buttons being caught in the controller casing when pressed down and glitches within the hardware causing the system to freeze occasionally while playing a game.
